parameters.name: parent
parameters.description:
Parent is a fully qualified string that contains information about the
owner in a hierarchical manner group/ location/ business (required).

parameters.name: first
parameters.description:
First specifies the number of rows that are to be returned starting after
the the cursor (value of after) (required if last is 0 and before is
empty).

parameters.name: after
parameters.description:
After takes any value as cursor to get the data after that point. Data
should be sorted on type of value specified for After. For example, id, datetime,
name...
(required if last is 0 and before is empty).

parameters.name: last
parameters.description:
Last specifies the number of rows that are to be returned ending before the
the cursor (value of before) (required if first is 0 and after is empty).

parameters.name: before
parameters.description:
Before takes any value as cursor to get the data before that point. Data
should be sorted on type of value specified for Before For Ex. id,
datetime, name...
(required if first is 0 and after is empty).

parameters.name: viewMask
parameters.description:
ViewMask contains the list of field from Service object that has to be returned.
If a FieldMask object is not present then return all the field from the Service object.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: Query is searched in Name of services

parameters.name: filters.statuses
parameters.description:
- UNSPECIFIED: Service status unspecified.
 - INTERNAL: Service can only be booked through the administrator portal,
i.e., by service providers, managers, admins, etc.
 - EXTERNAL: Service can be booked from both the client booking portal and the administrator portal,
i.e., by employees and customers.
 - LINK_ONLY: Service can only be booked by those having the unique link generated corresponding to the service.

parameters.name: viewMask
parameters.description:
ViewMask contains the list of field from Service object that has to be returned.
If a FieldMask object is not present then return all the field from the Service object.

parameters.name: metadata
parameters.description: This is a request variable of the map type. The query format is "map_name[key]=value", e.g. If the map name is Age, the key type is string, and the value type is integer, the query parameter is expressed as Age["bob"]=18

parameters.name: service.id
parameters.description: Id is the unique identifier for the service

get.summary: GetServiceSetting returns a service setting based on its unique id

parameters.description:

parameters.name: serviceSetting.id
parameters.description:
Id is of the location or service. Settings can be set at multiple levels.
When retrieving for a level. The service returns the object by merging all the levels
giving precedence to the lowest level.

get.summary: GetServiceToken returns the service token by its unique id.

delete.summary:
DeleteServiceToken will delete the service token from the system by Id.
This will be a soft delete from the system

put.summary:
UpdateServiceToken will update the service token identified by its service token id.
Update ServiceToken uses Field Mask to update specific properties of service token object

delete.summary:
DeleteServiceTemplate will delete the service template from the system by Id.

Update ServiceTemplate uses Field Mask to update specific properties of service template object

@type.description:
A URL/resource name that uniquely identifies the type of the serialized
protocol buffer message. This string must contain at least
one "/" character. The last segment of the URL's path must represent
the fully qualified name of the type (as in
`path/google.protobuf.Duration`). The name should be in a canonical form
(e.g., leading "." is not accepted).

In practice, teams usually precompile into the binary all types that they
expect it to use in the context of Any. However, for URLs which use the
scheme `http`, `https`, or no scheme, one can optionally set up a type
server that maps type URLs to message definitions as follows:

* If no scheme is provided, `https` is assumed.
* An HTTP GET on the URL must yield a [google.protobuf.Type][]
  value in binary format, or produce an error.
* Applications are allowed to cache lookup results based on the
  URL, or have them precompiled into a binary to avoid any
  lookup. Therefore, binary compatibility needs to be preserved
  on changes to types. (Use versioned type names to manage
  breaking changes.)

Note: this functionality is not currently available in the official
protobuf release, and it is not used for type URLs beginning with
type.googleapis.com. As of May 2023, there are no widely used type server
implementations and no plans to implement one.

Schemes other than `http`, `https` (or the empty scheme) might be
used with implementation specific semantics.

servicev1Status.description:
- UNSPECIFIED: Service status unspecified.
 - INTERNAL: Service can only be booked through the administrator portal,
i.e., by service providers, managers, admins, etc.
 - EXTERNAL: Service can be booked from both the client booking portal and the administrator portal,
i.e., by employees and customers.
 - LINK_ONLY: Service can only be booked by those having the unique link generated corresponding to the service.

hasNext.description:
HasNext is used to indicate whether more edges exist following the set
defined by the clients arguments. If the client is paginating with
first/after, then the server must return true if further edges exist,
otherwise false. If the client is paginating with last/before, then the
client may return true if edges further from before exist, if it can do so
efficiently, otherwise may return false.

hasPrevious.description:
HasPrevious is used to indicate whether more edges exist prior to the set
defined by the clients arguments.
If the client is paginating with last/before, then the server must return
true if prior edges exist, otherwise false. If the client is paginating
with first/after, then the client may return true if edges prior to after
exist, if it can do so efficiently, otherwise may return false.

oneTimeAcceptance.title:
one_time_acceptance: if true specifies that the policy is accepted only
once or only when a new version is published.
And when it is false, the policy will be accepted every time the source
is invoked or used

various booking settings. Please refer to the object for
the exact settings.

various payment settings. Please refer to the object for

emailVerifiedCustomer.title: Booking approved by the customer through mail

phoneVerifiedCustomer.title: Booking approved by the customer through phone

prePayingCustomer.title: Booking approved by the customer through payment

customerWithCreditCard.title: Booking approved by the customer through payment

nonEmailVerifiedCustomer.title: Booking approved by the customer through non verified mail

nonPhoneVerifiedCustomer.title: Booking approved by the customer through non verified phone

v1AppointmentBookingApproval.title:
Levels over which the booking is approved by the customer
This setting can be override at service level

leadAndCancellationSetting.title: Lead and cancellation settings of any service which is booked

bookingApproval.description: BookingApproval contains settings to control which appointments require approval.

fixedInterval.title: in case of fixed availability type

minAdvanceIntervalToBook.title: Min Time prior to which the appointment can only be booked

intervalAdvanceAppointmentCanBeBooked.title: Advance time after which an appointment cannot be booked in seconds

minIntervalBetweenAppointments.title: Minimum time interval required between appointments

v1AppointmentLeadAndCancellationSetting.title:
All the settings are in seconds
these setting can be override at service level

minAdvanceInterval.title: Time prior to which update can be done

penalties.title:
how much penalties is to be cut for time before `key` seconds
key in seconds and value in percentage

updateFutureAppointments.description:
UpdateFutureAppointments will update all booked appointments in future with the
new policy details.

v1AppointmentUpdatePolicy.description:
AllowUpdate type will allow all types of update without any restriction
DoNotAllowUpdate type will restricts all types of update
FixedIntervalUpdate type will only all updates prior to the MinAdvanceInterval
And AllowWithPenalty type will allow all updates but with certain Penalties defined as percentages

Penalties will only work with AllowWithPenalty type.
For reschedule policy, AllowWithPenalty will not work
v1AppointmentUpdatePolicy.title:
AppointmentUpdatePolicy specifies the intent of update that can be performed
freely or with penalty based on the AppointmentUpdatePolicyType

v1AppointmentUpdatePolicyType.title: AppointmentUpdatePolicyType represents the type of update policy to be used

v1Approval.title: Type of approval, whether required or not

v1ChargeType.title: Type of charge when a service is booked by a customer

chargeType.title: Whether the customer is charged or not

chargeValue.title: Incase of fixed_amount it is amount and in case of percentage it is percentage

acceptPrePayment.title: Accept pre-payments (Enable or disable this setting)
